text: Jordan Brian Henderson (born 17 June 1990) is an English professional footballer who plays as a midfielder for Dutch team Ajax Amsterdam and plays for the England national team. He was born in Sunderland, Tyne and Wear. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Club Season League National cup League cup Continental Other Total Division Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Sunderland 2008–09 Premier League 1 0 0 0 1 0 — — 2 0 2009–10 Premier League 33 1 2 0 3 1 — — 38 2 2010–11 Premier League 37 3 1 0 1 0 — — 39 3 Total 71 4 3 0 5 1 — — 79 5 Coventry City (loan) 2008–09 Championship 10 1 3 0 — — — 13 1 Liverpool 2011–12 Premier League 37 2 5 0 6 0 — — 48 2 2012–13 Premier League 30 5 2 0 2 0 10 1 — 44 6 2013–14 Premier League 35 4 3 0 2 1 — — 40 5 2014–15 Premier League 37 6 7 0 4 0 6 1 — 54 7 2015–16 Premier League 17 2 0 0 3 0 6 0 — 26 2 2016–17 Premier League 24 1 0 0 3 0 — — 27 1 2017–18 Premier League 27 1 1 0 1 0 12 0 — 41 1 2018–19 Premier League 32 1 0 0 1 0 11 0 — 44 1 2019–20 Premier League 30 4 0 0 0 0 6 0 4 0 40 4 2020–21 Premier League 21 1 1 0 0 0 6 0 0 0 28 1 2021–22 Premier League 35 2 5 0 5 0 12 1 — 57 3 2022–23 Premier League 35 0 2 0 1 0 4 0 1 0 43 0 Total 360 29 26 0 28 1 73 3 5 0 492 33 Al- Ettifaq 2023–24 Saudi Pro League 11 0 2 0 — — — 13 0 Career total 452 34 34 0 33 2 73 3 5 0 597 39 ===International=== Appearances and goals by national team and year National team Year Apps Goals England 2010 1 0 2012 4 0 2013 2 0 2014 11 0 2015 4 0 2016 10 0 2017 4 0 2018 12 0 2019 7 0 2020 3 0 2021 10 2 2022 6 1 2023 6 0 Total 80 3 :England score listed first, score column indicates score after each Henderson goal List of international goals scored by Jordan Henderson No. Date Venue Cap Opponent Score Result Competition 1 3 July 2021 Stadio Olimpico, Rome, Italy 62 4–0 4–0 UEFA Euro 2020 2 12 November 2021 Wembley Stadium, London, England 68 3–0 5–0 2022 FIFA World Cup qualification 3 4 December 2022 Al Bayt Stadium, Al Khor, Qatar 73 1–0 3–0 2022 FIFA World Cup ==Honours== Liverpool *Premier League: 2019–20 *FA Cup: 2021–22; runner-up: 2011–12 *Football League Cup/EFL Cup: 2011–12, 2021–22; runner-up: 2015–16 *FA Community Shield: 2022 *UEFA Champions League: 2018–19; runner-up: 2017–18, 2021–22 *UEFA Super Cup: 2019 *FIFA Club World Cup: 2019 *UEFA Europa League runner-up: 2015–16 England *UEFA European Championship runner-up: 2020 *UEFA Nations League third place: 2018–19 Individual *England U21 Player of the Year Award: 2012 *Liverpool Young Player of the Year: 2011–12 *Sunderland Young Player of the Year: 2009–10, 2010–11 *Premier League Goal of the Month: September 2016 *England Senior Men's Player of the Year: 2019 *FWA Footballer of the Year: 2019–20 *Liverpool Fans' Player of the Season: 2019–20 *PFA Team of the Year: 2019–20 Premier League *ESM Team of the Year: 2019–20 Orders *Member of the Order of the British Empire: 2021 ==References== ==Other websites== *Jordan Henderson profile at the Liverpool F.C. website *Jordan Henderson profile at The Football Association website *Jordan Henderson career stats at Soccerbase Category:1990 births Category:Living people Category:English footballers Category:Liverpool F.C. players Category:People from Sunderland Category:Sportspeople from Tyne and Wear Category:Sunderland A.F.C. players Category:Premier League players Category:2022 FIFA World Cup players
